title: Male and Female Offering Bearers
section: The Late Period through the Beginning of the Roman Occupation

museum_location.name: 19th Dynasty to Roman Period, Martha A. and Robert S. Rubin Gallery, 3rd Floor

completeness.name: Best
completeness.description: All data has been vetted. Objects generally have quality photos and descriptions.

labels.content: These figures must once have formed part of a tomb relief of a procession of figures bringing offerings to the deceased. Semi-nudity for subservient figures is not rare in Egyptian art. However, the combination of these figures' scanty attire, the boldness of the relief carving, and the semi-frontal depiction of the woman is sufficiently unusual to help date this relief to the second half of the fourth century B.C.

collections.name: Egyptian, Classical, Ancient Near Eastern Art
